section.p: To perform your tasks, you use the user interface. The role of your organization as a broker and your user role within the organization determine which features are available to you at the user interface.

distinguishes between the following user roles within broker organizations:
Administrator: Each organization must have at least one user with this role.
Broker: This role allows a user to publish a supplier's marketable services without changing the terms and conditions defined by the supplier.

To access the user interface, you use the login information provided by in the email confirming the creation of your user account. If your organization uses an external authentication system, passwords are managed in this system. This means that you log in with the password as stored in this system, and the email sent by does not contain a password.
To log in to the administration portal where you will perform your tasks:

ol.li:
Click the link provided in the email, or type the access URL in your Web browser's address bar.
The access URL has the following format:
https://<host_fqdn>:8081/oscm-portal
<host_fqdn> is the fully qualified name or IP address of the host used to access , 8081 is the port. oscm-portal is the default context root of and cannot be changed.
If your organization uses an external system for user management and authentication, the identifier of a corresponding tenant may be appended to the URL:
https://<host_fqdn>:8081/oscm-portal/?tenantID=<id>

On the Login page, type your user ID and password.
Depending on the system used for user authentication, the Login page may be that of or of an external provider like Microsoft Azure, or it may be skipped entirely if single sign-on is supported and you are already logged in.
